name: selective catalytic reduction of nitrogen oxides | NOx retained, by selective catalytic reduction | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5180/documentation

This dataset represents the denitrification process of a coal power plant through selective catalytic reduction per 1 kg NOx retained. The efficiency of the denitrification is 85%.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Denitrification process starting with the operation of a coal power plant.

This activity ends with 1 kg retained NOx resulting from the denitrification process of a coal power plant. The dataset includes apart the materials also the disposal.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: In the DeNOx process major focus is put on primary measures such as flue gas recirculation, staged combustion and low NOx burners. If these measures do not lead to a certain emission level, selective catalytic reduction (SCR) methods are used. Primary measures reduce NOx emissions up to 60%. Therefore, only constructional measures are needed and no operational material is necessary. The emissions from dry firing can be reduced to 450mg/m3, emissions from slag tap firing to 900mg/m3. In case of lignite power plants, emissions from dry firing can be reduced even up to 200mg/m3 and the sharpest limits can be met without secondary denitrification. SCR is used for large coal combustions as a secondary DeNOx system. It can be installed before (high dust) or after (low dust) the dust separator, or even after the flue gas desulfurisation plant. ;With the reducing agent ammonia (NH3), nitrogen oxides are converted into nitrogen and water. That these reactions occur quickly enough even at low flue gas temperatures, a catalyst of metal oxides, molecular sieve, activated coal or coke is needed. SCR methods achieve efficiencies of 80% to 90%. With a NH3/NOx mol ratio of about 0.8 an efficiency up to 85% is achieved. As the NOx concentration in the boiler varies, the catalytic performance increases with prolonged lifetime and the applied load of the catalytic converter changes as a result of load changes, the SCR system has to be well regulated. Furthermore, NH3 reacts with SO3 to ammonium hydrogen sulfate, which can lead to inactivation of the catalyst converter (IPP 1990). Through the pressure loss of the catalyst converter, additional electricity of 0.35% of net capacity is needed (Wagner 1989) and considered in the net efficiency.;;References:;IPP Karlsruhe (1990) Entsorgung von Reststoffen aus der Rauchgasreinigung; Teil 2: TA Luft-Feuerungsanlagen. Ministerium für Umwelt Baden-Württemberg. Karlsruhe.;Wagner H.-J. (1989) Aufschlüsselung von Investitionskosten. Jül-Spez 524, Jülich.

exchanges.description:
Stoichiometric calculation. The stoichiometric ammonia requirement is 0.38 kg per kg of NO. Since also side reactions occur, effectively 0.45 kg of ammonia per kg NO respectively 0.3 kg of ammonia per kg NO2 is necessary.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description:
Estimation. At a molar ratio of 0.8 NH3/NOx the ammonia slip is under 2 to 10 pmm or about 1 kg/TJ (0.003 kg/kg NOx).

Further references:
Voos H. (1985) Rauchgasreinigung - angewandte Verfahren und Entwicklungen. In: Steinmetz E. (Hrsg.) "Planung, Bau und Betrieb von Wärmekraftwerken", Haus der Technik, Vortragsveröffentlichungen, Heft 501, Essen.

flow.name: Ammonia
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation. With a reduction of 1000 to 200 mg NOx/m3, about 0.04 m3/t NOx of catalytic converter volume are necessary. This causes investment costs of approximately 450€/t NOx including installation and disposal. With a density of 0.66 t/m3 (Marx et al. 1990), 26 kg/t NOx of catalytic converter are required. With a weight of 0.87 t/MW (Wagner 1989), about 24 kg/t NOx are needed. According to (Franke et al. 1989) V2O5-TiO2 mixed oxides are used on ceramic metal or honeycomb bodies. To prevent adverse reactions to ammonium hydrogen sulfate and to improve the selectivity, trace amounts of tungsten oxide or niobium are used. According to (Lange et al. 1991), the coating consists of more than 90% of TiO2, 0.5% to 5% of V2O5 and 5% to 10% of WO3. TiO2 is taken for the total mass of the catalytic converter since the other components are not available in the database.

Further references: 
Wagner H.-J. (1989) Aufschlüsselung von Investitionskosten. Jül-Spez 524, Jülich.
Franke F.H., Guntermann K.J., Paersch M.J. (1989) Kohle und Umwelt. Bergbau Rohstoffe Energie, Band 26, Essen.
Lange M., Bade M., Günther G., Haug N. (1991) Luftreinhaltung bei Kraftwerks- und Industriefeuerungen. In: VWK Bd.43 Nr.4. s.198-203

exchanges.description:
Estimation. The disposal of the catalyst converter (consisting of TiO2, V2O5 and WO3) is achieved by integration into building materials or by deposition as hazardous waste. With an increasing amount of old catalyst converters it is assumed that reconditioning is possible. The catalyst weight of 25 kg/t NOx is considered as hazardous waste.
EcoSpold01Location=DE
